programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Craig’s determined that he and the guys will be the “Last Band Standing” at Degrassi’s battle of the bands and win a spot on the show. So he sets the guys a fierce practice schedule and starts to write a killer new song.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The year-end Junior Formal is fast approaching, and Marco is in charge, except when it comes to a date. Problem is, Marco’s too nervous to ask Dylan out at all, let alone ask him to the prom.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: A stressed-out Paige and Spinner decide they need a break and skip school for the day. Ashley, meanwhile, is in the doldrums, too “sick” to go to school. So when Ashley calls Paige to get her homework, Paige decides Ash needs to join them in a little fun.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Once again, as things finally start to come together for Sean, the other shoe drops - his brother and guardian, Tracker, has found a new job in Alberta. Sean thinks his life is over until he finds out that he can legally live on his own.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The year end semi-formal is only hours away and Marco has transformed the gym into an idealized Bombay. It promises to be an amazing event, except Marco’s theme is causing tension between him and Ellie. Ellie finds the whole idea racist - cultural appropriation in the name of superficial fun.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.sub-title: The Ghost In the Machine, Pt.1
programme.desc: It’s the end of summer and Paige receives some unexpected news - her rape case has finally made it to trial and she’s the star witness. Finally…justice!

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.sub-title: The Ghost In the Machine, Pt.2
programme.desc: Shocked by the outcome of the trial, Paige holes up in her room. But when Marco is able to coax her out to party at Dylan’s dorm with the gang, things go from bad to worse when she and Spinner have a blow-out fight.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Marco’s a shoo-in for Student Council President until Alex enters the race. While at first Alex seems an unlikely candidate, her strong opinions and anti-establishment platform take hold with the students and Marco realizes she might well win.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Feeling ignored on Student Council, Emma finds a way to get her voice heard when she takes up a new cause - ganging up with the cool kids to keep Terri’s abusive ex-boyfriend Rick, out of Degrassi.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Things are going great for Sean and Ellie, Degrassi’s most unlikely couple—so well that Sean asks Ellie to move in. Despite their closeness, Ellie hesitates and Sean doesn’t understand why.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: In her quest to repay Spinner for damage to his car, Alpha Paige has gone all beta. Suddenly, Spin’s using his new-found powers to zap whatever self-confidence Paige has left, much to the disgust of Paige’s friends – she’s even wearing a poly-blend uniform for her new job at the mall theatre’s concession stand!

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Rick decides to get back at his bullies, hitting them right where it hurts – their cars. But when Jimmy becomes a member of the “Whack Your Brain” team, the two form a truce.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Rick returns to Degrassi after the “Whack Your Brain” debacle at the hands of Spinner, Jay and Alex. Toby and Mr. Raditch try to convince him to take the afternoon off, to go home and cool off, but an oddly calm Rick chooses to stay, promising Toby that their enemies are going to pay for what they did.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: After the shooting at Degrassi, the full school board counseling response team moves in. And so does the media. Local reporter, Rachel Roberts, has decided to make Sean the hero of her piece.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Craig has a problem – the recording deal he and his band won last year is about to expire, but “Downtown Sasquatch” is nowhere near ready to record. With Jimmy in the hospital, they’re missing a key member.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Craig’s back with Ashley and he’s determined not to screw it up this time.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Distraught when Ashley’s refuses his proposal, Craig falls into a major rage, completely trashing his hotel room. But when Ashley calls and says she’s reconsidered, Craig is elated and while at Ashley’s dad’s wedding, he announces that he and Ashley are engaged.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Degrassi has a new hottie in Grade 9 and Manny’s got her eye on him. Especially since her “boyfriend” Spinner can’t even be bothered to take a night off work to come to the Cupid Dance she’s organized.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Something’s wrong with Emma. Though she’s frustrated at being treated with kid gloves by everyone since the school shooting, she’s not sure how she’d rather be treated. So she just keeps going on, numbly reassuring everyone that she’s fine so they’ll leave her alone.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Emma steps into the lead role in Dracula, but her recent extra-curricular activities with Jay prove even more dramatic. A public health nurse has been called in as a number of students—including Jay’s girlfriend Alex-- have been diagnosed with gonorrhea.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Spinner has difficulty dealing with the return of injured Jimmy. He hasn’t talked to him since the shooting, and his guilt over what he did leaves him unable to welcome Jimmy back to school. But Jimmy wants to things to return to normal, which means having all his friends around him.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Ellie is finding it hard to make ends meet now that she’s living on her own and hates relying on her mother for rent, especially with its obligatory dinners to pick up the cheque.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.sub-title: Modern Love (aka Love Will Tear Us Apart)
programme.desc: Paige and Matt are totally in love, so what if they have to keep it secret? It’s worth all the extra effort. But when Manny reveals the secret during a heated fight with Paige, she learns that Matt might not be as comfortable with their relationship once it becomes public knowledge—and jeopardizes his teaching career.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: With school coming to a close, Marco is making huge plans for his summer with Dylan – and their future. He’s considering fast-tracking to graduate high school, joining Dylan in university a year earlier.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: After dutifully picking up the Spirit Squad slack for a love-struck Paige all year, Manny feels betrayed when Paige claims all the glory. So Manny plots her revenge with a complicated cheer that leaves Paige with a broken leg on Prom Night.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.sub-title: Goin' Down The Road, Pt. 1 (aka All Cried Out, Pt.1)
programme.desc: Ashley’s leaving for the summer, and the idea of their temporary farewell and the stress of writing a song for Kevin Smith’s movie -- is making him, well, nuts. So Craig decides to do whatever it takes to follow her, finding a summer music school program that would be perfect.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.sub-title: Goin' Down The Road, Pt. 2 (aka All Cried Out, Pt.2)
programme.desc: Frustrated by everything around him, Craig runs away. As he wanders the street, he befriends a young busker nicknamed, “Skinny”.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Another year at Degrassi kicks off and Manny decides she's going to be a serious actress, whatever it takes.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Manny's still foggy on what exactly it was that happened at Peter's party the night before.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Paige has got her whole life mapped out.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: JT has got his licence. He’s got a steady girlfriend in Liberty, who happens to be Student Council President

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: After all the craziness of last year, Craig has one overriding goal: no drama.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.sub-title: I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For
programme.desc: Jimmy is invited to try out for the Wheelchair Basketball Association’s Junior Team.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: As Liberty’s pregnancy enters its sixth month, she and JT are forced to face reality.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Desperate for cash, JT has stolen drugs from the pharmacy…

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Someone’s interested in Marco but as it turns out, Tim is interested in Marco but not for the expected reason.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The one-year anniversary of the school shooting is approaching and everyone's feeling the weight of it.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Tonight is the premiere of “Jay and Silent Bob Go Canadian, Eh”.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Paige wakes Alex up in her bed, Paige spent the night on the floor and they awkwardly prepare for school.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Craig bursts into rehearsal with good news – they’ve been accepted to perform at a Northern Sounds Showcase.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Since being "saved" everything has been going Spinner's way.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The Simpson-Nelson household is in chaos.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Emma is finally getting some control over her life.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Facing the pressure of year-end exams, the furthest thing from Marco’s mind is what happened a year ago.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The end of another school year finds Darcy’s faith – in her boyfriend – being put to the test.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: As Paige and Spinner awkwardly discuss last night's surprising kiss-fest, Darcy interrupts.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: When Peter receives a new car for his birthday, he quickly becomes a frequent face in the street racing scene.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Things heat up between Emma and Sean.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Emma is happy that the racing debacle is behind them, and that Peter is finally free.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Jimmy starts the year off with big plans, coaching the girl’s junior basketball team.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Peter, hoping to join the Spirit Squad, links Darcy’s personal web page to his.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Darcy's online admirers take up more and more of her time, and her relationship with Spinner suffers.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: After Career Aptitude test results come in, Spinner is less than pleased with his results.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.desc: After being released from jail, Sean finds himself sleeping on Spike & Snake’s couch.

programme.title: Degrassi: The Next Generation
programme.sub-title: What's It Feel Like to be a Ghost? Pt. 1
programme.desc: Craig’s back in town for a music festival – and Manny can’t help picking up right where they left off.
